title.narrative: 4.2 QUALITY EARLY LEARNING FOR ALL

description.narrative: By 2020, Government has improved capacity to provide increased access to inclusive and quality early learning services, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, girls and boys benefit equitably from improved preschool education and enhanced quality of basic education including in emergencies.

title.narrative: By 2020, Government has improved capacity to provide increased access to inclusive and quality early learning services

description.narrative: Government’s initiatives to enhance equitable access to quality Early Childhood Care and Education (ECCE) are supported through:;designing and testingalternative and innovative methods of preschool educationprovision;in two regions;;ensuring ECCE continuityby introducingremotelearning;programmes;during;COVID-19 pandemic;(reaching out to an estimated 800,000 children);continuing the efforts to enhancetheimplementation andeffectiveness of Early Learning Development Standards (ELDS) and new preschool curriculum;and skilling 38,400;teachers; and developing training materials;(training package of 6 guidebooks) for the same; informing ECCE interventiondecisions with results from studies and international experiences; and enhancing Information, Education and Communication (IEC) activities for reaching out to parents, teachers and community at large.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/01/2021
